page.title: 09Roads in East Kilbride
page.content: The dual carriageways which take the through traffic are built for speed and safety. By keeping pedestrians off these roads traffic can pass through at 50 mph. Pedestrians are separated from the roads by fences and can only cross at bridges or underpasses. Smaller gently curving roads like West Mains Road take cars through the neighbourhoods at 30 mph. To get to housing areas cars have to turn into much narrower and winding roads where they must travel more slowly. Many people actually live in cul-de-sacs so cars cannot pass through. In all cases roads are separated from pavements by grass verges for maximum safety. The area where this pattern breaks down is the village area which is a conservation area and thus the narrow roads with shops on each side must remain as they are. (see Photo B)
